verses.verse: So (Num. 14:23, 28-30; Deut. 1:35; Heb. 4:3, 5) I swore in My wrath, ‘They shall not enter My rest.’ ”
(A Song of Praise to God Coming in Judgment) Oh, (1 Chr. 16:23-33) sing to the LORD a new song! Sing to the LORD, all the earth.
Sing to the LORD, bless His name; Proclaim the good news of His salvation from day to day.
Declare His glory among the nations, His wonders among all peoples.
For (Ps. 145:3) the LORD is great and (Ps. 18:3) greatly to be praised; (Ps. 95:3) He is to be feared above all gods.
For (1 Chr. 16:26; (Jer. 10:11)) all the gods of the peoples are idols, (Ps. 115:15; Is. 42:5) But the LORD made the heavens.
Honor and majesty are before Him; Strength and (Ps. 29:2) beauty are in His sanctuary.
(1 Chr. 16:28, 29; Ps. 29:1, 2) Give to the LORD, O families of the peoples, Give to the LORD glory and strength.
Give to the LORD the glory due His name; Bring an offering, and come into His courts.
Oh, worship the LORD (1 Chr. 16:29; 2 Chr. 20:21; Ps. 29:2) in the beauty of holiness! Tremble before Him, all the earth.
Say among the nations, (Ps. 93:1; 97:1; (Rev. 11:15; 19:6)) “The LORD reigns; The world also is firmly established, It shall not be moved; (Ps. 67:4) He shall judge the peoples righteously.”
(Ps. 69:34; Is. 49:13) Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad; (Ps. 98:7) Let the sea roar, and all its fullness;
